sentences.en: Bob slid from his chair and lay prone on the floor.
sentences.cn: 鲍勃从椅子上滑下来，趴在了地板上。

sentences.en: For all her experience as a television reporter, she was still prone to camera nerves.
sentences.cn: 尽管有丰富的做电视记者的经验，她仍然倾向于在镜头前紧张。

sentences.en: He was lying prone on the couch, fast asleep.
sentences.cn: 他趴在长沙发椅上, 睡得很熟.

sentences.en: He was prone to indigestion after rich restaurant meals.
sentences.cn: 上饭馆吃过油腻食物之后,他常受消化不良之苦.

sentences.en: He's probably prone to domestic violence.
sentences.cn: 他也许有家庭暴力的倾向。

sentences.en: He's prone to flit between subjects with amazing ease.
sentences.cn: 他往往会轻松自如地转换话题。

sentences.en: His eyes shifted to the prone body on the floor.
sentences.cn: 他的视线移向了趴在地上的尸体。

sentences.en: People with fair skin who sunburn easily are very prone to develop skin cancer.
sentences.cn: 皮肤白皙容易晒伤的人极易患皮肤癌。

sentences.en: Questions involving the environment are particularly prone to uncertainty.
sentences.cn: 涉及到环境的问题尤其可能产生不确定性.

sentences.en: Since 1991, parents have been advised not to put their infants down to sleep in the prone position.
sentences.cn: 自1991年以来就一直建议父母不要让婴儿趴着睡觉。

sentences.en: Some people are prone to jump to hasty conclusions.
sentences.cn: 有些人往往作出轻率的结论.

sentences.en: The police found him in a prone position with a knife in his back.
sentences.cn: 警方发现他俯卧着,背上有一把刀.

sentences.en: The test should identify which smokers are most prone to develop lung cancer.
sentences.cn: 这项检查应该可以确认哪些吸烟者更容易得肺癌。

sentences.en: These plants are peculiarly prone to disease.
sentences.cn: 这些植物特别容易发生病变。

sentences.en: This leaves fertile soil unprotected and prone to erosion.
sentences.cn: 这会让肥沃的土壤暴露在外，使其容易受到侵蚀。

sentences.en: Working without a break makes you more prone to error.
sentences.cn: 连续工作不停歇使人更容易出错。

words.tran_cn: 将手掌向下或向后转动

trans.tran_cn: 易于…的，俯卧的，有…倾向的，倾斜的，坡陡的
trans.tran_en: likely to do something or suffer from something, especially something bad or harmful
